Rule.Name: Ensure AppArmor is installed (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: AppArmor is not installed, leaving the system without mandatory access control for applications.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Install the AppArmor packages and utilities to enable mandatory access control.

Rule.Name: Ensure AppArmor is enabled in the bootloader configuration (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: AppArmor is not enabled in the bootloader configuration, which may prevent it from starting at boot.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Edit /etc/default/grub to include "apparmor=1 security=apparmor" in GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX and update the bootloader.

Rule.Name: Ensure all AppArmor profiles are in enforce or complain mode (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Some AppArmor profiles are not set to enforce or complain mode, reducing the effectiveness of mandatory access control.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set all AppArmor profiles to either enforce or complain mode according to your security policy.

Rule.Name: Ensure all AppArmor profiles are enforcing (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Not all AppArmor profiles are set to enforce mode, potentially leaving the system vulnerable.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure all AppArmor profiles are set to enforce mode.
